fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time

Class Duration

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Duration
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The class Duration defines a representation for duration values with their time unit as well as methods to manipulate them.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant               simulatedDuration >= 0.0
 invariant               timeUnit != null

    Created on : 2016-02-15

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Duration INFINITY
      the representation of the duration infinity i.e., the largest possible.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      protected double simulatedDuration
      the value of the duration represented by this object.
      protected java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit
      the time unit of this duration, allowing to unambiguously interpret it.
      static double TOLERANCE
      tolerance on the precision of floating points d to consider two durations as equal.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Duration(double simulatedDuration, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      create a new duration object with the given duration value and time unit.

      • Duration

        public Duration(double simulatedDuration,
                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        create a new duration object with the given duration value and time unit.

        Contract

         pre     simulatedDuration >= 0.0
 pre     timeUnit != null
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        simulatedDuration - represented duration value.
        timeUnit - time unit of the represented duration.
